Hi Emma-Lou, at this stage our focus is on recovering all of our packaging so none of it ends up as litter or in the oceans. However, we’re working hard to ensure our packaging is as sustainable as possible. When plastic packaging is responsibly disposed of, it can be recycled and used again and again. Currently we use 25% recycled plastic and have committed to doubling the amount to 50% by 2020. We’d like to use more but there’s not enough recycled plastic in the UK at the moment, we need more bottles to be recycled. This is why as part of our strategy we will be seeking reform of the recycling system in the UK to improve recovery and recycling rates. We’ve also been researching and creating alternatives to oil based plastics, such as our PlantBottle™, which is the first-ever recyclable plastic bottle made from plants. We use the PlantBottle for all of our Honest Tea and Smartwater range here in Great Britain and are always looking at ways that we can expand its use across our portfolio.

As a huge contributer to plastic waste pollution, I believe, and I'm sure many others including yourselves believe, you have a duty to keep your plastics from ending up where they shouldn't. What efforts Coca-Cola, exactly, will you make to massively minimising (on an enormous scale) your non recycled waste? Will you be putting it to the government to start a bottle deposit scheme? As it has proved very successful in germany. Will you be funding ocean clean ups? Also, away from the UK, as Coca-Cola is a world wide organisation, what precautions will be made globally? Including third world countries where coke is also sold. This is a world wide issue afterall.
